snippet: Reality TV stars who promote themselves as problem solvers would make interesting fits in the next president’s cabinet.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger Critic's Notebook on genre of reality television, described as Fix-It TV, in which self-appointed problem solvers and experts try to improve things that work poorly; suggests which reality stars would be suited to positions in next presidential cabinet.
lead_paragraph: Reality TV stars who promote themselves as problem solvers would make interesting fits in the next president’s cabinet.

headline.seo: Reality TV and the Presidential Cabinet
headline.main: Here’s the Reality: The Cabinet Needs a Jolt
headline.print_headline: Here’s the Reality: The Cabinet Needs a Jolt
